client_timeout.description: Timeout (in seconds) of the Keycloak client

initial_login.description: Whether or not to login to Keycloak instance on provider initialization

red_hat_sso.description: When true, the provider will treat the Keycloak instance as a Red Hat SSO server, specifically when parsing the version returned from the /serverinfo API endpoint.

root_ca_certificate.description: Allows x509 calls using an unknown CA certificate (for development purposes)

tls_insecure_skip_verify.description: Allows ignoring insecure certificates when set to true. Defaults to false. Disabling security check is dangerous and should be avoided.

url.description: The base URL of the Keycloak instance, before `/auth`

name.description: IDP Mapper Name
IDP Mapper Name

browser_flow.description: Which flow should be used for BrowserFlow

client_authentication_flow.description: Which flow should be used for ClientAuthenticationFlow

direct_grant_flow.description: Which flow should be used for DirectGrantFlow

docker_authentication_flow.description: Which flow should be used for DockerAuthenticationFlow

registration_flow.description: Which flow should be used for RegistrationFlow

reset_credentials_flow.description: Which flow should be used for ResetCredentialsFlow

authenticator.description: Might be needed to be set with certain custom subflow with specific authenticator, in general this will remain empty

name.description: IDP Mapper Name

changed_sync_period.description: How frequently Keycloak should sync changed users, in seconds. Omit this property to disable periodic changed users sync.

enabled.description: When false, this provider will not be used when performing queries for users.

full_sync_period.description: How frequently Keycloak should sync all users, in seconds. Omit this property to disable periodic full sync.

name.description: Display name of the provider when displayed in the console.

parent_id.description: The parent_id of the generated component. will use realm_id if not specified.

priority.description: Priority of this provider when looking up users. Lower values are first.

provider_id.description: The unique ID of the custom provider, specified in the `getId` implementation for the UserStorageProviderFactory interface

realm_id.description: The realm (name) this provider will provide user federation for.

default_roles.description: Realm level roles assigned to new users.

client_id.description: The mapper's associated client. Cannot be used at the same time as client_scope_id.

client_scope_id.description: The mapper's associated client scope. Cannot be used at the same time as client_id.

name.description: A human-friendly name that will appear in the Keycloak console.

protocol.description: The protocol of the client (openid-connect / saml).

protocol_mapper.description: The type of the protocol mapper.

realm_id.description: The realm id where the associated client or client scope exists.

client_id.description: The destination client of the role. Cannot be used at the same time as client_scope_id.

client_scope_id.description: The destination client scope of the role. Cannot be used at the same time as client_id.

role_id.description: Id of the role to assign

authorization_resource_server_id.description: Resource server id representing the realm management client on which this permission is managed

name.description: IDP Mapper Name

user_session.description: Is Attribute Related To a User Session

name.description: IDP Mapper Name

authorization_idp_resource_id.description: Resource id representing the identity provider, this automatically created by keycloak

authorization_resource_server_id.description: Resource server id representing the realm management client on which this permission is managed

authorization_token_exchange_scope_permi.description: Permission id representing the Permission with scope 'Token Exchange' and the resource 'authorization_idp_resource_id', this automatically created by keycloak, the policy id will be set on this permission

clients.description: Ids of the clients for which a policy will be created and set on scope based token exchange permission

policy_id.description: Policy id that will be set on the scope based token exchange permission automatically created by enabling permissions on the reference identity provider

policy_type.description: Type of policy that is created. At the moment only 'client' type is supported

ldap_user_federation_id.description: The ldap user federation provider to attach this mapper to.

name.description: Display name of the mapper when displayed in the console.

provider_id.description: ID of the custom LDAP mapper.

provider_type.description: Fully-qualified name of the Java class implementing the custom LDAP mapper.

realm_id.description: The realm in which the ldap user federation provider exists.

ldap_user_federation_id.description: The ldap user federation provider to attach this mapper to.

attribute_value.description: Value of the LDAP attribute. You can hardcode any value like 'foo'

ldap_user_federation_id.description: The ldap user federation provider to attach this mapper to.

name.description: Display name of the mapper when displayed in the console.

realm_id.description: The realm in which the ldap user federation provider exists.

always_read_value_from_ldap.description: When true, the value fetched from LDAP will override the value stored in Keycloak.

attribute_default_value.description: Default value to set in LDAP if is_mandatory_in_ldap and the value is empty

is_binary_attribute.description: Should be true for binary LDAP attributes

is_mandatory_in_ldap.description: When true, this attribute must exist in LDAP.

ldap_attribute.description: Name of the mapped attribute on LDAP object.

ldap_user_federation_id.description: The ldap user federation provider to attach this mapper to.

name.description: Display name of the mapper when displayed in the console.

read_only.description: When true, this attribute is not saved back to LDAP when the user attribute is updated in Keycloak.

realm_id.description: The realm in which the ldap user federation provider exists.

user_model_attribute.description: Name of the UserModel property or attribute you want to map the LDAP attribute into.

batch_size_for_sync.description: The number of users to sync within a single transaction.

bind_dn.description: DN of LDAP admin, which will be used by Keycloak to access LDAP server.

changed_sync_period.description: How frequently Keycloak should sync changed LDAP users, in seconds. Omit this property to disable periodic changed users sync.

connection_url.description: Connection URL to the LDAP server.

custom_user_search_filter.description: Additional LDAP filter for filtering searched users. Must begin with '(' and end with ')'.

delete_default_mappers.description: When true, the provider will delete the default mappers which are normally created by Keycloak when creating an LDAP user federation provider.

edit_mode.description: READ_ONLY and WRITABLE are self-explanatory. UNSYNCED allows user data to be imported but not synced back to LDAP.

enabled.description: When false, this provider will not be used when performing queries for users.

full_sync_period.description: How frequently Keycloak should sync all LDAP users, in seconds. Omit this property to disable periodic full sync.

import_enabled.description: When true, LDAP users will be imported into the Keycloak database.

name.description: Display name of the provider when displayed in the console.

pagination.description: When true, Keycloak assumes the LDAP server supports pagination.

priority.description: Priority of this provider when looking up users. Lower values are first.

rdn_ldap_attribute.description: Name of the LDAP attribute to use as the relative distinguished name.

realm_id.description: The realm this provider will provide user federation for.

search_scope.description: ONE_LEVEL: only search for users in the DN specified by user_dn. SUBTREE: search entire LDAP subtree.

start_tls.description: When true, Keycloak will encrypt the connection to LDAP using STARTTLS, which will disable connection pooling.

sync_registrations.description: When true, newly created users will be synced back to LDAP.

trust_email.description: If enabled, email provided by this provider is not verified even if verification is enabled for the realm.

use_password_modify_extended_op.description: When `true`, use the LDAPv3 Password Modify Extended Operation (RFC-3062).

user_object_classes.description: All values of LDAP objectClass attribute for users in LDAP.

username_ldap_attribute.description: Name of the LDAP attribute to use as the Keycloak username.

users_dn.description: Full DN of LDAP tree where your users are.

uuid_ldap_attribute.description: Name of the LDAP attribute to use as a unique object identifier for objects in LDAP.

validate_password_policy.description: When true, Keycloak will validate passwords using the realm policy before updating it.

vendor.description: LDAP vendor. I am almost certain this field does nothing, but the UI indicates that it is required.

eviction_day.description: Day of the week the entry will become invalid on.

eviction_hour.description: Hour of day the entry will become invalid on.

eviction_minute.description: Minute of day the entry will become invalid on.

max_lifespan.description: Max lifespan of cache entry (duration string).

block.description: Settings regarding cache policy for this realm.

kerberos_realm.description: The name of the kerberos realm, e.g. FOO.LOCAL

key_tab.description: Path to the kerberos keytab file on the server with credentials of the service principal.

use_kerberos_for_password_authentication.description: Use kerberos login module instead of ldap service api. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: Settings regarding kerberos authentication for this realm.

accepts_prompt_none_forward_from_client.description: This is just used together with Identity Provider Authenticator or when kc_idp_hint points to this identity provider. In case that client sends a request with prompt=none and user is not yet authenticated, the error will not be directly returned to client, but the request with prompt=none will be forwarded to this identity provider.

add_read_token_role_on_create.description: Enable/disable if new users can read any stored tokens. This assigns the broker.read-token role.

alias.description: The alias uniquely identifies an identity provider and it is also used to build the redirect uri. In case of google this is computed and always google

default_scopes.description: The scopes to be sent when asking for authorization. See the documentation for possible values, separator and default value'. Default: 'openid profile email'

disable_user_info.description: Disable usage of User Info service to obtain additional user information?  Default is to use this OIDC service.

display_name.description: Not used by this provider, Will be implicitly Google

first_broker_login_flow_alias.description: Alias of authentication flow, which is triggered after first login with this identity provider. Term 'First Login' means that there is not yet existing Keycloak account linked with the authenticated identity provider account.

hosted_domain.description: Set 'hd' query parameter when logging in with Google. Google will list accounts only for this domain. Keycloak validates that the returned identity token has a claim for this domain. When '*' is entered, any hosted account can be used.

link_only.description: If true, users cannot log in through this provider.  They can only link to this provider.  This is useful if you don't want to allow login from the provider, but want to integrate with a provider

post_broker_login_flow_alias.description: Alias of authentication flow, which is triggered after each login with this identity provider. Useful if you want additional verification of each user authenticated with this identity provider (for example OTP). Leave this empty if you don't want any additional authenticators to be triggered after login with this identity provider. Also note, that authenticator implementations must assume that user is already set in ClientSession as identity provider already set it.

provider_id.description: provider id, is always google, unless you have a extended custom implementation

request_refresh_token.description: Set 'access_type' query parameter to 'offline' when redirecting to google authorization endpoint, to get a refresh token back. Useful if planning to use Token Exchange to retrieve Google token to access Google APIs when the user is not at the browser.

store_token.description: Enable/disable if tokens must be stored after authenticating users.

trust_email.description: If enabled then email provided by this provider is not verified even if verification is enabled for the realm.

use_user_ip_param.description: Set 'userIp' query parameter when invoking on Google's User Info service.  This will use the user's ip address.  Useful if Google is throttling access to the User Info service.

accepts_prompt_none_forward_from_client.description: This is just used together with Identity Provider Authenticator or when kc_idp_hint points to this identity provider. In case that client sends a request with prompt=none and user is not yet authenticated, the error will not be directly returned to client, but the request with prompt=none will be forwarded to this identity provider.

add_read_token_role_on_create.description: Enable/disable if new users can read any stored tokens. This assigns the broker.read-token role.

alias.description: The alias uniquely identifies an identity provider and it is also used to build the redirect uri.

backchannel_supported.description: Does the external IDP support backchannel logout?

default_scopes.description: The scopes to be sent when asking for authorization. It can be a space-separated list of scopes. Defaults to 'openid'.

disable_user_info.description: Disable usage of User Info service to obtain additional user information?  Default is to use this OIDC service.

first_broker_login_flow_alias.description: Alias of authentication flow, which is triggered after first login with this identity provider. Term 'First Login' means that there is not yet existing Keycloak account linked with the authenticated identity provider account.

issuer.description: The issuer identifier for the issuer of the response. If not provided, no validation will be performed.

link_only.description: If true, users cannot log in through this provider.  They can only link to this provider.  This is useful if you don't want to allow login from the provider, but want to integrate with a provider

post_broker_login_flow_alias.description: Alias of authentication flow, which is triggered after each login with this identity provider. Useful if you want additional verification of each user authenticated with this identity provider (for example OTP). Leave this empty if you don't want any additional authenticators to be triggered after login with this identity provider. Also note, that authenticator implementations must assume that user is already set in ClientSession as identity provider already set it.

provider_id.description: provider id, is always oidc, unless you have a custom implementation

store_token.description: Enable/disable if tokens must be stored after authenticating users.

trust_email.description: If enabled then email provided by this provider is not verified even if verification is enabled for the realm.

ui_locales.description: Pass current locale to identity provider

validate_signature.description: Enable/disable signature validation of external IDP signatures.

add_to_id_token.description: Indicates if this claim should be added to the id token.

client_scope_id.description: The mapper's associated client scope. Cannot be used at the same time as client_id.

included_client_audience.description: A client ID to include within the token's `aud` claim. Cannot be used with included_custom_audience

included_custom_audience.description: A custom audience to include within the token's `aud` claim.  Cannot be used with included_custom_audience

browser_flow.description: Which flow should be used for BrowserFlow

client_authentication_flow.description: Which flow should be used for ClientAuthenticationFlow

direct_grant_flow.description: Which flow should be used for DirectGrantFlow

docker_authentication_flow.description: Which flow should be used for DockerAuthenticationFlow

password_policy.description: String that represents the passwordPolicies that are in place. Each policy is separated with " and ". Supported policies can be found in the server-info providers page. example: "upperCase(1) and length(8) and forceExpiredPasswordChange(365) and notUsername(undefined)"

registration_flow.description: Which flow should be used for RegistrationFlow

reset_credentials_flow.description: Which flow should be used for ResetCredentialsFlow

ssl_required.description: SSL Required: Values can be 'none', 'external' or 'all'.

algorithm.description: What hashing algorithm should be used to generate the OTP.

type.description: OTP Type, totp for Time-Based One Time Password or hotp for counter base one time password

signature_algorithms.description: Keycloak lists ES256, ES384, ES512, RS256, RS384, RS512, RS1 at the time of writing
Keycloak lists ES256, ES384, ES512, RS256, RS384, RS512, RS1 at the time of writing

active.description: Set if the keys can be used for signing

enabled.description: Set if the keys are enabled

name.description: Display name of provider when linked in admin console.

secret_size.description: Size in bytes for the generated AES Key. Size 16 is for AES-128, Size 24 for AES-192 and Size 32 for AES-256. WARN: Bigger keys then 128 bits are not allowed on some JDK implementations

active.description: Set if the keys can be used for signing

enabled.description: Set if the keys are enabled

alias.description: The alias uniquely identifies an identity provider and it is also used to build the redirect uri.

backchannel_supported.description: Does the external IDP support backchannel logout?

entity_id.description: The Entity ID that will be used to uniquely identify this SAML Service Provider.

first_broker_login_flow_alias.description: Alias of authentication flow, which is triggered after first login with this identity provider. Term 'First Login' means that there is not yet existing Keycloak account linked with the authenticated identity provider account.

link_only.description: If true, users cannot log in through this provider.  They can only link to this provider.  This is useful if you don't want to allow login from the provider, but want to integrate with a provider

post_broker_login_flow_alias.description: Alias of authentication flow, which is triggered after each login with this identity provider. Useful if you want additional verification of each user authenticated with this identity provider (for example OTP). Leave this empty if you don't want any additional authenticators to be triggered after login with this identity provider. Also note, that authenticator implementations must assume that user is already set in ClientSession as identity provider already set it.

provider_id.description: provider id, is always saml, unless you have a custom implementation

store_token.description: Enable/disable if tokens must be stored after authenticating users.

trust_email.description: If enabled then email provided by this provider is not verified even if verification is enabled for the realm.

validate_signature.description: Enable/disable signature validation of SAML responses.
